text: tres dos uno an explosive starts to the
construction of a telescope that will
revolutionize astronomy in an instant
the top of this 3000 meter high mountain
is flattened clearing the way for the
extremely large telescope located in
Chile's Atacama Desert this animation
shows what the giant structure will look
like the whole thing is bigger than a
football stadium at its hearts lies a
mirror measuring 40 metres across
letting us look deeper into the cosmos
than ever before at the moment this
fuzzy snapshot of deep space is the best
that most ground-based telescopes can
provide even images from the Hubble
telescope lack clarity and definition
but the new telescope will bring stars
and galaxies into focus transforming our
view of the universe scientists from the
University of Oxford are part of the
team behind the project which involves
15 countries from around the world with
the extremely large telescope will we
hope to see right back as far as we can
go into the observable universe and look
at the very first stars that formed and
when basically the universe switched on
projects like this don't come cheap the
cost comes in at more than a billion
dollars but astronomers say their new
view of space will be worth it and the
telescope will be up and running in a
decade
Rebecca Morelle beep see news
